com.mvp4g.client.event
Interface EventBus

All Known Subinterfaces:
EventBusWithLookup
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseEventBus, BaseEventBusWithLookUp
public interface EventBus

Interface that defines an event bus. All classes defining an event bus must implement it.

Author:
plcoirier

 void setFilteringEnabledForNextOne(boolean filteringEnabled)
          Set whether or not the associated event filters should be executed before sending the next event to the associated event handlers.

This method should be called only right before sending an event that could be filtered.
 void setHistoryStored(boolean historyStored)
          Set for all events if they should be stored or not in browser history when possible (ie when associated with an history converter).
 void setHistoryStoredForNextOne(boolean historyStored)
          Set for next event that can be stored in history if it should be stored or not in browser history.

This method should be called only right before sending an event that could be stored in browser history.
 

Method Detail

setHistoryStored

void setHistoryStored(boolean historyStored)
Set for all events if they should be stored or not in browser history when possible (ie when associated with an history converter).

Parameters:
historyStored - true if events should be stored

setHistoryStoredForNextOne

void setHistoryStoredForNextOne(boolean historyStored)
Set for next event that can be stored in history if it should be stored or not in browser history.

This method should be called only right before sending an event that could be stored in browser history.

Parameters:
historyStored - true if events should be stored

isHistoryStored

boolean isHistoryStored()
Indicate if events are stored in browser history when possible (ie when associated with an history converter).

Returns:
true if events can be stored in browse history

setFilteringEnabled

void setFilteringEnabled(boolean filteringEnabled)
Set whether or not the associated event filters should be executed before sending the event to the associated event handlers.

Parameters:
filteringEnabled - true if events filters should be executed

setFilteringEnabledForNextOne

void setFilteringEnabledForNextOne(boolean filteringEnabled)
Set whether or not the associated event filters should be executed before sending the next event to the associated event handlers.

This method should be called only right before sending an event that could be filtered.

Parameters:
filteringEnabled - true if events filters should be executed

isFilteringEnabled

boolean isFilteringEnabled()
Indicate if event filters should be executed before sending events to handlers.

Returns:
true if events filters should be executed

addHandler

<T extends EventHandlerInterface<?>> T addHandler(java.lang.Class<T> handlerClass)
                                              throws Mvp4gException
Create a new instance of the handler, bind it and add it to event bus.

. Calling this method is equivalent to addHandler(handlerClass, true);

Type Parameters:
T - type of the handler created
Parameters:
handlerClass - class of the handler to create
Returns:
new instance of the handler created
Throws:
Mvp4gException - thrown if the instance of the handler can not be created by the event bus

addHandler

<T extends EventHandlerInterface<?>> T addHandler(java.lang.Class<T> handlerClass,
                                                  boolean bind)
                                              throws Mvp4gException
Create a new instance of the handler, bind it only if this option is set to true and add it to event bus. If you decide not to set the handler at creation, you will have either make sure the handler is displayed only after it handles its first method (otherwise the view is not binded so it seems inactive) or call manualy the bind method.

Type Parameters:
T - type of the handler created
Parameters:
handlerClass - class of the handler to create
bind - if true, bind the handler at creation, otherwise do nothing.
Returns:
new instance of the handler created
Throws:
Mvp4gException - thrown if the instance of the handler can not be created by the event bus

removeHandler

<T extends EventHandlerInterface<?>> void removeHandler(T handler)
Remove the instance of the handler from the event bus

Type Parameters:
T - type of the handler to remove
Parameters:
handler - handler to remove

addEventFilter

void addEventFilter(EventFilter<? extends EventBus> filter)
Add a new event filter

Parameters:
filter - new event filter to add

removeEventFilter

void removeEventFilter(EventFilter<? extends EventBus> filter)
Remove event filter

Parameters:
filter - event filter to remove
